aas:langStringTextType.aas:text: defaultAdminShell

aas:langStringPreferredNameTypeIec61360.aas:text: Planned Production Output of a Supplier

aas:langStringDefinitionTypeIec61360.aas:text: This aspect represents the remaining and planned production outputs of a supplier allocated to a customer. An allocated planned production output is described by a quantity, the site of the supplier and the date with time at which a production of a certain material for a certain customer is planned to be finished. The allocated planned production outputs may be linked to customer order position they have been scheduled for.

aas:langStringTextType.aas:text: This aspect represents the remaining and planned production outputs of a supplier allocated to a customer. An allocated planned production output is described by a quantity, the site of the supplier and the date with time at which a production of a certain material for a certain customer is planned to be finished. The allocated planned production outputs may be linked to customer order position they have been scheduled for.

The positions refer to positions within an order of the given product (see material number supplier, materialNumber customer and material global Asset Id) for which the production outputs are transferred. The positions can be differentiated by the order position reference. If no order position reference is given, then there is only one position containing all planned production outputs of the product.
The Position can be planned for production at several sites. A position may be anonymous or may reference a position within an order.
Encapsulates the references to identify a position within an order.
This is the order number on the supplier side that is given by e.g., the supplier's enterprise resource planning system.
This is the order number on the customer side that can be given by e.g., the customer's enterprise resource planning system.

This is an identifier for the position of an order defined by the customer. It's not a technical identifier, such as an UUID. This identifier is used within the business context when talking about the position.
Date and time at which the position has been updated by the supplier's systems. Date and time are set according to the timezone.
Planned Production Outputs already allocated to the customer.
Quantity, site of the supplier and date with time at which a production of a certain material for a certain customer is planned to be finished.
Entity for common measurements of an item (mass, count, linear, area, volume, misc) with an unit and a value.
The quantity value associated with the unit.
The unit of an item. Common units may be related to mass, count, linear, area, volume or misc.
One planned and allocated production output has always one site. The site is identified by the BPNS.
Date and time on which the planned and allocated production output is estimated to be completed. Date and time are set according to a timezone.

Material identifier as assigned by the customer. This material number identifies the material (as planned) in the customer's database. For standard parts (e.g. screws) for which a customer does not have an own number, the material number supplier should be set in this field, too.

aas:langStringNameType.aas:text: Material Number UUID of the Customer's Twin

aas:langStringTextType.aas:text: Material identifier used uniquely to identify the Material (e.g. PartAsPlanned).
Material identifier as assigned by the supplier. This material number identifies the material (as planned) in the supplier's database.

aas:langStringNameType.aas:text: Planned Production Output of a Supplier

aas:langStringTextType.aas:text: This aspect represents the remaining and planned production outputs of a supplier allocated to a customer. An allocated planned production output is described by a quantity, the site of the supplier and the date with time at which a production of a certain material for a certain customer is planned to be finished. The allocated planned production outputs may be linked to customer order position they have been scheduled for.

aas:langStringPreferredNameTypeIec61360.aas:text: Planned Production Output of a Supplier

aas:langStringDefinitionTypeIec61360.aas:text: This aspect represents the remaining and planned production outputs of a supplier allocated to a customer. An allocated planned production output is described by a quantity, the site of the supplier and the date with time at which a production of a certain material for a certain customer is planned to be finished. The allocated planned production outputs may be linked to customer order position they have been scheduled for.
This is a proprietary order ID, generated by either the supplier side or customer side.
This is a proprietary order ID, generated by either the supplier side or customer side.
The position ID is unique for an order and used within business context to refer to a position.
The order position reference includes reference numbers for the order and the position. As these information are meant for the customer, the customer reference numbers are mandatory.
The quantity value associated with the unit expressed as float.
Describes the quantity and the unit of measure with which the planned and allocated production output is measured.
Trait to ensure data format for BPNS.

aas:langStringNameType.aas:text: Planned and Allocated Production Output Collection

aas:langStringDefinitionTypeIec61360.aas:text: Collection of planned and allocated production outputs that may relate to different production locations and estimated time of completions.

If any production for the customer is planned, then there is at least one position. If the supplier does differentiate the planned production according to the order positions (an OrderPositionReference is set), then multiple positions can be given. Among the positions, there could be only one position without an OrderPositionReference to either report the planned production independently of orders or to report internal stock orders planned for the customer.
The material number is a multi-character string, usually assigned by an ERP system.

aas:langStringPreferredNameTypeIec61360.aas:text: Material Number UUID of the Customer's Twin

aas:langStringDefinitionTypeIec61360.aas:text: Trait to ensure UUID v4 data format.
The material number is a multi-character string, usually assigned by an ERP system.
